I use JUnitPerf for performance and thread testing all the time.
It allows you to identify the number of users (threads) calling your 
JUnit tests as well as the number of iterations by each thread.
You can also put a time limit in the execution of the test so if 
performace drops, it will fail the test.  That way if something bad was 
introduced that broke performance, you will see it.

Best Wishes,
Dave
